page.title: 18Lower Wivenhoe
page.content: JW Cooks Shipyard can make sea-going vessels and is SE of Wivenhoe.Its employees volunteer to man the local Fire Station. Near the yard are small unmetalled roads with dense housing in this Tree Conservation Area. Many houses were built for fishermen and sailors and have sail lofts. Small light industries like Dry Cleaners and boat builders occupy a previous Gas Works site. Also 50 units are for rent in one small industrial works closed in 1982. North of the Colchester-Clacton Railway Line are Victorian Terraces and 2 1960-80's Housing Estates, partly built in the depression of previous sand excavations. The flood plain is crossed by a dis- used railway which used to link Colchester to Brightlingsea and pro- tected from high tides by a levee.
